div.p: NARRATOR: As I continue around the spiral, I may sometimes experience changes that happen in the brain that affect my memory when I make high-risk choices.
NARRATOR: Memory blackouts are one example. Blackouts erase the memory of some problems. Let's say that I got intoxicated at a party and caused a big fight that really ruined the night for everybody.

NARRATOR: If you were with me at the party, and you were not in a blackout, then you would clearly see a problem that I would have no memory of. So, it does not seem like a problem to me, because I don't remember it happening!
